cmd:CorporateBodiesPersonsFamiliesDescri.cmd:history: Mile Mrkšić was born near Vrginmost, in present-day Croatia. As a professional military officer, Mrkšić participated in the operations of the Yugoslav People's Army during and in the aftermath the siege of the town of Vukovar, Croatia in summer and autmn of 1991. His alleged participation in the killing of over 200 Croatian prisoners of war following the fall of Vukovar in November 1991 formed the basis for 1995 indictment against him at the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia. Mrkšić voluntarily surrendered to the ICTY in May 2002 and was tried with his two co-accused, Miroslav Radić and Veselin Šljivančanin, between October 2005 and March 2007. The Trial Chamber found Mrkšić guilty of murder, torture and cruel treatment as violations of the laws or customs of war and convicted him to 20 years of imprisonment in September 2007. The ICTY Appeals Chamber confirmed the 20 years sentence in May 2009. In August of 2012, Mile Mrkšić waas transferred to Portugal to serve the remainder of his sentence. Mrkšić died on 16 August 2015.
